4.1.1.7.1.3. unduwave.undu_modules.undu_magnets

Contains the wave_from_b class that incorporates the API from python to WAVE and the function create_wave_instance that returns an instance of that class

4.1.1.7.1.3.1. Classes

point_coords

undu_magnets

Collects a group of magnets into a list and implements some functionality on that list, like move,mirror,clc-creation,

undu_magnet_block_coords

Implements basic undumag magnet block

Returns list of all objects whose name contains one of:

calculate_forces_ue51(load_clc_file, ueparas, center, ...)

if row, period, block or mag are empty lists, it means they are all to be taken together

class unduwave.undu_modules.undu_magnets.undu_magnet_block_coords(p_center, pnts=None, len_x=None, len_y=None, len_z=None, magnetization=None, magn_unit_vec=None, name='name', mother='mother', segm_x=1, segm_y=1, segm_z=1, frac_y=1, frac_z=1, material='mag', chamf=None, api=None)

Implements basic undumag magnet block can be moved, mirrored, incorporated into undumag-clc and the extent can be calculated

material - “magnet” or “pole” chamf - if some float - chamfer is added

get_max_extent(maxs=None, mins=None)

determines the extent of this magnet block and compares to maxs and mins vals given, returns the max and min vals

unduwave.undu_modules.undu_magnets.get_magn_ignore(n_magn_ignore, ignore_level, magns_ignore=[])

n_magn_ignore : number of magnet to be ignored ignore_level : ‘u’/’l’ - upper or lower rows

unduwave.undu_modules.undu_magnets.create_magnetization_unit_vec(magn_string)
unduwave.undu_modules.undu_magnets.get_magnet_period(magn_collection, denominator, nperiod, n_el_per_period=4, offset=0)
unduwave.undu_modules.undu_magnets.get_magnet_struct(magn_collection, denominator, magn_nums=[])

Returns list of all objects whose name contains one of: { denominator and str(magn_nums[i]) | forall i}

unduwave.undu_modules.undu_magnets.calculate_forces_ue51(load_clc_file, ueparas, center, magnetizations, undu_p, undu, shifts, rows, periods, blocks, mags, add='')

if row, period, block or mag are empty lists, it means they are all to be taken together i.e. : if mag=[], all magnets [0,1] are to be taken together for each block defined - block forces

block =[], so all blocks in a given period together - period forces period=[], all periods in a given row together - row-forces row=[], whole machine
